title: Videotapes of Visitors to Ravenite Club Played at Gotti Trial
title_page: Videotapes of Visitors to Ravenite Club Played at Gotti Trial - The New York Times
maintext:
It was time for home movies in the courtroom yesterday, as Federal prosecutors played videotapes of John Gotti and dozens of associates walking in and out of the Ravenite Social Club, which investigators call the Manhattan headquarters of the Gambino crime family.
With the courtroom lights dimmed, Mr. Gotti turned in his chair to look at his own image flickering across a large screen behind the defense table, while an agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation used a laser beam to point out people appearing in the silent surveillance tapes.
"This is the doorway to the Ravenite club," said the agent, George Gabriel, who provided a running commentary for the jury in the racketeering-murder trial of Mr. Gotti and Frank Locascio in Federal District Court in Brooklyn.
"John Gotti and Frank Locascio entering the club," Mr. Gabriel said, aiming his laser beam at the images on the screen. Informer Seen With Gotti
